title: Script doesnt record non-deploy transactions

body:
uhh right. I used script template which used `vm.broadcast()` not `vm.startBroadcast()`. Some ideas for improvements: 

1. Maybe it's a good idea to change that to standard start/stop broadcast block. Scripts documentation doesn't even mention `vm.broadcast()`... 
2. What about `vm.stopBroadcast()` throwing when it's not broadcasting?

WDYT?

The template uses `vm.broadcast` because it broadcasts a single transaction - it doesn't use `stopBroadcast`. On the docs for `stopBroadcast` the examples use `startBroadcast`. What improvement do you suggest?

For 2. that's a good point
